intro: Eranthemum griffithii, commonly known as the pink flame plant, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant pink to red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Eranthemum griffithii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
